Engr. Rahid

	

	

	

	

	

CHAIN SLING (BS EN818)

DOCUMENTATION

A

B

C

Equipment manufacturer’s instruction & operational manual, & last test report/certificate/manufacturing

details available























STRUCTURE







Tag/Marking should be clear and legible; it must give all of the necessary information for the particular grade and type of sling and safe working load (7.1)







Max wear is 8% reduction in material diameter for the chain, components and fittings.







The maximum elongation, mainly due to seating and interlink wear, is 5%.







Unless the sling is specifically designed otherwise, the legs of multi-leg slings should be of equal length so that the seat of hooks, or bearing point of other fittings, is equal.  







There should be no signs of bending, twisting or other distortion to the chain, master link or other fittings. (6.3.1)







There should be no signs of nicks, cracks, corrosion or chemical attack. (6.3.1)







Hooks should show no signs of opening or of distortion and, where fitted, safety latches should be undamaged and operate freely.(5.1.3)







Chain should articulate freely.







Note:  A – Satisfactory   B – Not Satisfactory C – Not Applicable



This is to certify that above mentioned comments are correct and are verified by competent inspector after inspection, testing & examination of the subject equipment

CHAIN SLING (BS EN818)

DOCUMENTATION

A

B

C

Equipment manufacturer’s instruction & operational manual, & last test report/certificate/manufacturing

details available























STRUCTURE







Tag/Marking should be clear and legible; it must give all of the necessary information for the particular grade and type of sling and safe working load (7.1)







Max wear is 8% reduction in material diameter for the chain, components and fittings.







The maximum elongation, mainly due to seating and interlink wear, is 5%.







Unless the sling is specifically designed otherwise, the legs of multi-leg slings should be of equal length so that the seat of hooks, or bearing point of other fittings, is equal.  







There should be no signs of bending, twisting or other distortion to the chain, master link or other fittings. (6.3.1)







There should be no signs of nicks, cracks, corrosion or chemical attack. (6.3.1)







Hooks should show no signs of opening or of distortion and, where fitted, safety latches should be undamaged and operate freely.(5.1.3)







Chain should articulate freely.







Note:  A – Satisfactory   B – Not Satisfactory C – Not Applicable



This is to certify that above mentioned comments are correct and are verified by competent inspector after inspection, testing & examination of the subject equipment
